alert.note: Alert for Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 7:33PM CST until February 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Bledsoe and Sequatchie. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 732 PM CST, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain may result in additional flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dunlap, Pikeville, Palio, Old Cumberland, Brayton, Cagle and Fall Creek Falls State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
